intro: Hibbertia sandifordiae, commonly known as the sandfordia hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that is a woody capsule. Hibbertia sandifordiae is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands.
